meanings.definition: A structure built along the shore of a body of water for ships to dock at.
meanings.sent1: The wharf was busy with ships coming and going.
meanings.sent2: The sailors unloaded the cargo from the ship at the wharf.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls gathered around the wharf, hoping for a fishy treat.
meanings.sent4: The wharf stood like a giant arm reaching out to the sea.
meanings.sent5: The wooden planks of the wharf creaked under the weight of the ship.

meanings.definition: To moor or dock a ship at a wharf.
meanings.sent1: The captain skillfully maneuvered the ship to wharf it safely.
meanings.sent2: They needed to wharf the vessel before unloading the cargo.
meanings.sent3: The ship refused to wharf properly, causing a delay in unloading.
meanings.sent4: She had to wharf her boat quickly before the storm hit.
meanings.sent5: The crew worked together to wharf the ship without any mishaps.

meanings.definition: The area surrounding a wharf where goods are loaded and unloaded.
meanings.sent1: The warehouse near the wharf stored all the goods awaiting shipment.
meanings.sent2: The bustling activity around the wharf never seemed to stop.
meanings.sent3: The workers joked about having a race around the wharf with the cargo.
meanings.sent4: The business thrived due to its strategic location near the wharf.
meanings.sent5: The sounds of the city faded away as he walked closer to the wharf.
